New Records: Virat Kohli equalled Sachin Tendulkar's record of 49 ODI centuries
Ravindra Jadeja became the second Indian spinner to take a five-for in World Cups
Ravindra Jadeja claimed his second five-wicket haul in ODI cricket
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli scored 101* and equalled Sachin Tendulkar's record of 49 ODI centuries
Ravindra Jadeja took 5-33 to wreck South Africa's chase
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma won the toss and chose to bat
India laid the foundation for the 134-run third-wicket partnership between Kohli and Iyer
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli remarked that equalling Sachin Tendulkar's record was'stuff of dreams'
Ravindra Jadeja expressed his gratitude for the support of the crowd on Virat Kohli's birthday
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on Virat Kohli's 35th birthday
South Africa's joint second-lowest total in ODI cricket was 83
Kuldeep Yadav turned the ball both ways and came away with two wickets
Others: Hardik Pandya has been sidelined from the rest of the tournament due to injury
South Africa's troubles began with Quinton de Kock being bowled out in the second over of the chase
